column4: Hello, weird error here, it seems like a key on my PC (ubuntu 9.10) is being permanently pressed. But its not (continues even when keyboard unplugged). The key that is supposedly pressed is either F, "." or enter... just carries on and on.
clean your keyboard first thing
Rofl, same thing happens with like 3 keyboards.
does it do it in a livecd?
That was my first idea ;/
that sounds like hardware error
New logitech pc's, and I would rather not restart the machine if possible.
does it do it in tty or just in X?
The box is running x11vnc, but I am not sure why suddenly that would cause this.
Just on X.
does restarting X fix it?
At first I thought it was a user being a bastard and catting on a pipe.
Um, restarting X does fix it, but after a while it starts up.
(as in the problem resumes after a while)
it probably is a user being a bastard then
It's not.
The problem starts like when I am typing on X.
And w/e key I am pressing, it carries on
As if it is stuck
well im sorry I can't help you I have only ever seen that happen because of a cat or a broken/jammed keyboard
ok.
people use the right alt key?
Keymap issue or the hardware?
Totally.
